update.description:
Added a few functions to `common::Battery` to support porting of LinearBatteryPlugin and LinearBatteryConsumerPlugin from Gazebo classic. Specifically, the copy constructor \(for battery component definition in `ign-gazebo/include/ignition/gazebo/components/Battery.hh`\) and equal to operator \(for component creation in `SdfEntityCreator.cc`\).

Tested in [the port](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/234/acropolis-port-battery-plugin-from-gazebo/diff).
update.title: Battery additions for plugin port

content.raw: As a minor comment: there is a bit of code duplication in the constructor and the assignment operator but no relevant problems.
content.html: As a minor comment: there is a bit of code duplication in the constructor and the assignment operator but no relevant problems.

content.raw: Added in 35ef41c. Coverage is [now 99.04%](https://codecov.io/bb/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/src/35ef41c1509e270cbd53dee4a65d09c00b709e7d/src/Battery.cc). The one line that isn't covered requires a `nullptr` in a private function and was not covered before.
content.html: Added in 35ef41c. Coverage is now 99.04%. The one line that isn't covered requires a nullptr in a private function and was not covered before.

content.raw: Incorrect documentation, I think. This is not a pointer to an SDF element, right?
content.html: Incorrect documentation, I think. This is not a pointer to an SDF element, right?

content.raw:
Changed to `std::abs` from `cmath` in 81bdb7e

I started using `ignition::math::equal`, and then saw a comment in `CMakeLists.txt` to not compile a test if `ign-math` is not there. That seems to suggest that nothing else depends on `ign-math`, and since the use case here is pretty small, I opted to not depend on `ign-math`.
content.html:
Changed to std::abs from cmath in 81bdb7e

I started using ignition::math::equal, and then saw a comment in CMakeLists.txt to not compile a test if ign-math is not there. That seems to suggest that nothing else depends on ign-math, and since the use case here is pretty small, I opted to not depend on ign-math.

content.html: you could also use ignition::math::equal from ignition/math/Helpers.hh

content.raw: I think adding a virtual fuction breaks ABI; I'm not sure if any classes inherit from `Battery`, so I would just make this a non-virtual function
content.html: I think adding a virtual fuction breaks ABI; I'm not sure if any classes inherit from Battery, so I would just make this a non-virtual function

content.raw: for rule of 3, we want an `=` operator to go along with the copy constructor
content.html: for rule of 3, we want an = operator to go along with the copy constructor

content.raw: I like `std::abs` from `cmath` better than `fabs` from `math.h` these days
content.html: I like std::abs from cmath better than fabs from math.h these days
